title: Ticket #5048: Enable master to act as fully configurable glidein
description:
This concept came from Miron during a Blueprint discussion. If the master is submitted as an executable, create a scheme where it downloads a Condor binary distribution, installs it, configures it, and starts.

The idea is that the condor_master becomes a flexible glidein bootstrap stub.

Configuration info could come from command line arguments and/or a config file sent as part of the input sandbox.

A Python-based prototype exists (for usage with AutoPyFactory) which this Condor feature should make obsolete. But until then, the prototype can be used as a testbed to explore mechanisms, config, and features.

https://github.com/jhover/condor-glidein-wrapper
